name: Zammad
desc: Zammad, a web-based, open source user support/ticketing solution.

options.name: dataDir
options.desc: Path to a folder that will contain Zammad working directory.

options.name: database.createLocally
options.desc: Whether to create a local database automatically.

options.name: database.host
options.desc: Database host address.

options.name: database.name
options.desc: Database name.

options.name: database.passwordFile
options.desc: A file containing the password for  services.zammad.database.user .

options.name: database.port
options.desc: Database port. Use  null  for default port.
options.type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.name: database.settings
options.desc: The  database.yml configuration file as key value set. See <TODO> for list ofconfiguration parameters.

options.name: database.type
options.desc: Database engine to use.

options.name: database.user
options.desc: Database user.

options.name: enable
options.desc: Whether to enable Zammad, a web-based, open source usersupport/ticketing solution.

options.name: host
options.desc: Host address.

options.name: openPorts
options.desc: Whether to open firewall ports for Zammad

options.name: package
options.desc: The zammad package to use.

options.name: port
options.desc: Web service port.
options.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.name: redis.createLocally
options.desc: Whether to create a local redis automatically.

options.name: redis.host
options.desc: Redis server address.

options.name: redis.name
options.desc: Name of the redis server. Only used if  createLocally  isset to true.

options.name: redis.port
options.desc: Port of the redis server.
options.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.name: secretKeyBaseFile
options.desc: The path to a file containing the  secret_key_base secret.  Zammad uses  secret_key_base  to encrypt the cookie store,which contains session data, and to digest user auth tokens.  Needs to be a 64 byte long string of hexadecimal characters. You cangenerate one by running   openssl rand -hex 64 >/path/to/secret_key_base_file   This should be a string, not a nix path, since nix paths are copiedinto the world-readable nix store.

options.name: websocketPort
options.desc: Websocket service port.
options.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)
